clues.text: Following 9/11, many more of these undercover law enforcement professionals were added to commercial flights
A traditional Catholic prayer in Latin, it's also a beloved Schubert composition from 1825
Making up most of Turkey, it's the peninsula between the Black & Mediterranean Seas
For an orbiting body it's the product of mass, velocity & distance from the center of rotation
Don't hush & keep it down now! You don't have 'til Tuesday to remember this woman sang "Voices Carry"!
The Santa Maria runs aground (merry Christmas, Columbus!); Lorenzo de' Medici goes beyond de' medicine
Fort Sumter becomes a hot spot; Vassar College is founded but doesn't open for 4 years, for Sumter-related reasons
The Titanic goes down; Fenway Park goes up (at the cost of $650,000)
5 guys get busted at the Watergate; Harrison Schmitt is one of 2 to be the last to walk on the Moon (but not to moonwalk)
Jacques Marquette hits Quebec; the Great Plague of London ends, but don't worry, there's also a fire
The best friend of this title character, Boots is a little monkey who accompanies her on her adventures
On this show Charlotte York had a King Charles Spaniel named Elizabeth Taylor
The makers of "The Chilling Adventures of" her discovered that star Kiernan Shipka was allergic to the cats playing Salem
This man's loyal direwolf Grey Wind tragically perishes just like him during the Red Wedding

This 1960s talking horse was a horse, of course, & once hit a home run off Sandy Koufax in
Dodger Stadium
A 3-word way of saying you're an open book becomes this 3-letter abbreviation over on Reddit
A Peloton web page asks, "Should you do" this, like on the bike or treadmill, "or weights first?"
This shortened word comes before "research" to mean digging up dirt on political foes
A 13-letter word meaning of many varieties gets cut down to this 4-letter abbrev. we've only seen written--until now
Cut the lizard-related part off & you're left with this 4-letter shortened word, the "terrible" part
Think your school's got tradition? Thomas Aquinas got a degree & taught theology on the Left Bank at the U. of this city
Colleges in Dublin, Ireland & Hartford, Connecticut share this numeric & religiously inspired name
The University of Vermont was founded in this city back in 1791; go Catamounts!
Daniel Webster, a grad of this Ivy League school, argued & won an important 1819 Supreme Court case on its behalf
Scripps & Harvey Mudd are among the 7 California schools known collectively & alliteratively as these colleges
The Talmud says the Ark contained the tablets bearing these edicts
On top of the solid gold lid of the Ark known as the mercy seat were 2 figures of this type of angel with their wings outspread
Ark seekers have included an obsessed British lord digging around 1910 when Jerusalem was under the rule of this empire
The Ark disappeared around 587 B.C., possibly during the time of the capture of Jerusalem by this empire
After the Israelites entered the promised land, this people with whom they fought captured the Ark but returned it after 7 months
This phrase meaning to exaggerate involves increasing the size of a mound made by a burrowing animal
clues.response: making a mountain out of a mole hill

clues.text: Originally referring to Matthew, Mark, Luke & John's work, this 2-word phrase has come to mean anything believed unreservedly
With & without "monster", it's how Shakespeare described jealousy
On a plane, it's something flight attendants do to the doors; on the ice, it's a penalty involving a hit with a stick
An incomprehensible religious glossolalia gives us this phrase
If you don't know that Connemara & Tipperary are this type of whiskey, you need to travel more--& drink more
A double of the 101 proof from this brand named for an undomesticated fowl? OK, I'm not driving... or standing
North-of-the-border whiskies include Caribou Crossing & this other "C.C." named for its popularity in social establishments
Glenfiddich & Glenlivet are famous scotches of this type, meaning produced from the barley of just one distillery
Bill Samuels created this bourbon; wife Margie came up with the red wax & the name meaning a manufacturing symbol
It's a whim or personal inclination, maybe to try something
There's a business specialty in this popular translation of the Latin saying "de gustibus non est disputandum"
A peripatetic person, or a member of a peripatetic people
In biology, it's a system for giving names to organisms
A fungus that makes some grapes perfect for winemaking goes by this distinguished name
In "Animal Farm" Boxer is one of these beasts, a dedicated laborer eventually exploited & sent to a glue factory
4 different ghosts visit Ebenezer Scrooge in "A Christmas Carol", including this one who represents memory
In "Harry Potter & the Goblet of Fire", Fleur Delacour, a pupil at a French Academy of Magic, visits Hogwarts for this tournament
Using this character's eyeglasses allows the stranded boys to start a fire in "Lord of the Flies"
Malachi is the real name of "Buck" Mulligan, roommate of Stephen Dedalus mentioned in the first sentence of this novel

Locusts,
hail,
frogs,
darkness

The Lovers,
the Chariot,
the Hierophant,
the Fool
clues.response: tarot cards (cards in a tarot deck)

Richard Byrd got the Medal of Honor for flying over this directional extreme in 1926, but may have actually been off by miles
The first European to reach the west coast of Australia, Dirck Hartog was captain of a ship of this nation & landed there in 1616
In 1682 the explorer La Salle claimed all the land drained by this river & its tributaries for France
In the 1840s an expedition led by Sir John Franklin sought this elusive Arctic waterway but became stuck in the ice & all perished
Antonio Pigafetta, who chronicled the 1519-1522 Magellan expedition, was the first to document the Cebuano language in this island group

rounds.text: This title of a Hollywood blockbuster is a national symbol of Gabon
